boat.name: Ghost
boat.full_description: A sharpie design taken from offsets discovered by American naval historian Howard Chapelle. The design is believed to have been a light commercial fishing boat used in the San Juan Islands of Washington state in the NW USA around 1890. Masts are solid Oregon fir, spars are solid Florida cypress with live oak jaws. Blocks are mostly hand made of teak, interior fittings are simple to keep with it's working boat heritage, trimmed in pine.
boat.short_description: Reuel Parker designed, built by her original owner, cold moulded Sharpie schooner with centerboard.
